document.docAuthor: Oh, Minsuk, Yasunaga, Tomohide & Lee, Seunghwan
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic review of Phytocoris Fallén (Heteroptera: Miridae: Mirinae: Mirini) in Korea, with one new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic review of Phytocoris Fallén (Heteroptera: Miridae: Mirinae: Mirini) in Korea, with one new species

bibRefCitation.author: Linnavuori
bibRefCitation.refString: Linnavuori, R. E. (1963) Contribution to the Miridae fauna of the Far East III. Annales Entomologici Fennici, 29, 73 - 82.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Recognized by its moderate size; dorsum pattern highly diverse, pale brown to dark brown, or green; long, slender right paramere ( Fig. 10 ); male lobal sclerite leaflike, ovate ( Fig. 11 ). Similar to
P. minakatai
, but easily distinguish by longer antennal segment III and labium ( Figs. 4 D–E). In Korea , this species can be confused with
P. intricatus
, but can be distinguished by key (Couplet 6) below and the more ovate lobal sclerite. For more figures, diagnostic characters and description, see Kerzhner (1977 , 1988a ) and Yasunaga & Schwartz (2015) .

Host plants. Adults were found from
Abies sachalinensis F. Schmidt
,
Larix leptolepis (Sieb. et Zucc.) Gordon
,
Picea glehnii (F. Schmidt) Mast.
,
P. abies
(L.) H. Karst.
P. pungens Engelm.
( Pinaceae ),
Salix
spp. ( Salicaceae ),
Rhus javanica
L. ( Anacardiaceae ) ( Yasunaga & Schwartz, 2015 ); but immatures are yet to be found.

TABLE I. Measurements of Korean
Phytocoris
species.
